name: 專業倫理學研究
goals: Understand the basic principles and connotations of ethics.
Understand the theory, connotations and related issues of professional ethics.
Develop the ability to self-reflect on professional ethics and moral sensitivity and moral sense to real-world situations.
Cultivate the ability to make ethical judgments in the face of professional ethical cases.
Enhance the effectiveness of specific ethical practices.
syllabus:
Week 1 Introduction

Week 2 Definition of Ethics

Week 3 Utilitarianism

Week 4 Deontological Theories

Week 5 Virtue Approaches

Week 6 Ethical speculation

Week 7 The moral code of society — social justice

Week 8 Arthur Anderson Seven Steps of Situational Analysis

Week 9 Moral reasoning and judgment

Week 10 Code of Professional Ethics

Week 11 Contextual analysis of professional ethics issues (1):

Social justice and professional ethics, professional ethics, and environmental ethics

Week 12 Contextual Analysis of Professional Ethics Issues (2): Bioethics

Week 13 Situational Analysis of Professional Ethics Issues (3):

Teaching Ethics Sexual Minority and education

Week 14 Final Report Proposal Presentation (1)

Week 15 Final Report Proposal Presentation (2)

Week 16 Final Report Proposal Presentation (3)

methodologies.note:
Articles and issues related to the topic will be given in advance.
Group discussions will be conducted in classrooms.
Some of the topics will be discussed in terms of problem solving.
Some of the topics will involve with team works.
Audio-visual materials will be used for some of the topics especially about social or ethics issues.
Some of the topics will focus on professional ethics case studies.

grading.note: To evaluate students’ ability to perceive issues of reading the textbook.
To evaluate students’ ability to discuss issues of professional ethics.
To evaluate student’s ability to translate ideas and issues of professional ethics.
To evaluate student’s ability to analyze ideas of professional ethics in case studies.

prerequisite: ◎Available for junior and senior year B.A. program students (Doctoral program courses excepted) and M.A. program students.
